name: CodeSandbox
description: CodeSandbox is a project that manifested while I was working at Catawiki. I am responsible for rewriting pages to React and I noticed that my coworkers couldn't easily grasp what I was working on. Furthermore it was very hard to share my work with them without asking to install dependencies. CodeSandbox aims to solve this by making it possible to create React projects online in your browser. You can share your work by just sharing the URL, and it's very easy for others to play with.

name: SolarBoard
shortdescription: An app for showing and analyzing solar power winnings.
description:
Techniko is an installation company specialized in green power. They currently own more than 200 solar panels, but didn't have a way to see how much power they're generating. They wanted a simple way to see how much their solar panels were generating with the ability to compare the data.
I chose to make a website using the MEAN (MongoDB, Express, AngularJS, Node) stack. The website utilizes custom directives, filters and services. The backend has a RESTful API to communicate with the website. The data is gathered by kWh-meters and sent with an Arduino to a server which stores it in the database.
The demo above is based on generated data.

name: Relative

banner.image3desc: Rotating planet with player on it (debug view)

description: Relative has been my most complicated and biggest project thus far. It is a 2d sidescrolling RPG game with as much as possible procedural generation and mod support. Multiplayer is implemented too with a special authority system designed by myself. Mod support works great together with multiplayer, since the server will send the mods it has installed to the client connecting. I really love doing procedural generation, the moment when you surprise yourself with generated content is incredible.
features: Unique Distributed Authority System for multiplayer
Mod Support both on server and client

name: Counter
shortdescription: A turn based math game for Android.
description:
A mobile turn-based (Ruzzle-like) math game. This is the first game I made. Although it is not finished, it was almost finished. It has everything implemented except a statistic screen. A unique feature is the ability to challenge multiple players at once. This means you can play against a group of friends.
Like my other games this is also built on LibGDX and it uses AppEngine from Google for storing data.
